line_1: Yet their belief did work them muchel ruth.
line_2: His cheeks impurpled with the rose of youth;

line_1: Yet their belief did work them muchel ruth.
line_2: They thought they listen'd to the words of truth,

line_1: Yet their belief did work them muchel ruth.
line_2: His tongue was poisonous as an aspic's tooth.

line_1: In Accents fault'ring ay for Ruth
Is there no Pity, no relenting Ruth,
line_2: A Wretch! a Villain! lost to love and truth!

line_1: Is there no Pity, no relenting Ruth,
Is there no Pity, no relenting Ruth,
line_2: Curse on his perjur'd arts! dissembling smooth!

line_1: Nor fill our hearts with ruth;
His breast divided atween joy and ruth;
line_2: Return we now unto our gentle youth,

line_1: "My days roll'd on unknown to pain or ruth,
line_2: To whom the swain reply'd, "O gentle youth,

line_1: But stop'd; and chang'd his smiles to looks of ruth,
line_2: "Does Cupid thus impose upon thy youth?

line_1: But stop'd; and chang'd his smiles to looks of ruth,
line_2: "Dwells then in heav'n such envy, void of love and truth?
